Message.Title: SO glad I got out at 14 and put the money to work
Message.Msg: Sold Dell at 14 around the deal time. Bought HP at 16.65 the same day and sold it yesterday at $23. Invested the proceeds from HP into Blackberry yesterday which went up 6.45 % today. Planning to sell blackberry at 22 by April end. Translates to $5.20 profit per share in Dell and $6.35 per share in HP and currently 0.97 at BBRY in less than 2 months. Sticking to DELL would have paid just another buck. 18 is Dreaming. DELL is dead so get out and put your money to work. Huge dividends and money making in AGNC, TWO, PMT, MTGE.

Topic.Title: I think this stock could hit 18.00

Message.Msg: I'm not so sure... at $15 it is a winning bid on Friday. That is a direct challenge. Microsoft, or another player would need to pay for the additional cost if M. Dell were to rebid. Joe stockholder may not scoff at $1.36 increase from $13.64?? (maybe off a tad) I'm not sure, but I hope you're right.

Message.Title: what blackstone is doing
Message.Msg: What's the easiest way for BLK to make money off Dell? actually buy the company? Or float a rumor that sends price up, get short, and then cover on the drop when there is no other bid?

Message.Msg: That's a good point. There are 100,000 people saying that Dell is worth more than $13.65, yet there are zero higher bids. What is Mr. Icahn's bid? Will he even make a bid, or will he just keep asking Mike Dell to offer more? I could do that.

Topic.Title: Mr Icahn wins we always WIN

Message.Msg: Wow. Amazing to read the uninformed posts by peopple here. Dell is loosing money daily. At this point, Dell needs to take the 13.65 offer. The books will be worse as the days go by. I see this stock going to 9's and maybe below. T ime is running out. The next time they try to take Dell private Dell, the books will be ugly and the bid alot lower. JMO---------The exit will be fast so have your fingers on the trigger.

Message.Title: The fix is in to keep this stock down, STAY IN AND BE STRONG!!!
Message.Msg: HPQ LOSSED (12,650,000) and there stock price is $22.32, DELL had a profit of 2,372,000, Dell is trading $14.14.

Message.Title: Icahn and crew...
Message.Msg: I may be naive, but I do not see Carl just rolling over and giving up. He know this company is worth a lot more than $13.65 and it is worth a fight. I would guess he has had many conversations with BX and SW and they are working on something. Perhaps it's a larger offer, perhaps it's something that forces Dell to pay up to avoid a lengthy legal battle. Either way,I think the stock goes higher. Interesting that after hours someone bought 10M shares. Yes I know there was also a seller, but someone doesn't drop 140M on a guaranteed loser like this would be if Dell gets to steal the company. Just doesn't make sense. I suspect that whoever bought is someone in the know - perhaps Icahn or BX.

Topic.Title: Icahn and crew...

Message.Msg: How do you that 10m was a buy and not a sell? just curious

Topic.Title: Icahn and crew...

Message.Msg: As I said, there is a buyer and a seller. Large holders can sell for a number of reasons, but a large BUYER... Must know something.

Message.Title: Its simple blackstone=keep it public=$15.00=with option of cash or keeping your shares
Message.Msg: There is no need to try to skin stockholders who want a long term stock

Topic.Title: Icahn and crew...

Message.Msg: Stocks are traded meaning bought and sold. You can't have a buyer without a seller (besides arguably an IPO). The fact that 10mil shares were traded after hours in one block which was over 37% of the days volume and were at the closing price it is probably safe to assume they were not only bought but at market price too. This means someone wanted in badly in my opinion.

Topic.Title: What just happend, share price plunges on high turnover?

Message.Msg: It looks like someone "bought" a block of 10 million shares after hours at the ask price as the price of the stock is unchanged on a volume that is 37% of the volume traded while the market was open. With that kind of volume selling, you would expect to see a bigger downturn in my opinion. Who knows in this situation though.

Topic.Title: Its simple blackstone=keep it public=$15.00=with option of cash or keeping your shares

Message.Msg: I like it----Blackstone can run it and trim the management thats apparently not pushing this company forward.

Topic.Title: What just happend, share price plunges on high turnover?

Message.Msg: Cannot buy or sell 10m shares after hours without moving the price. This had to have been a market maker reporting an intraday purchase after the close.
